question: No established religion, freedom of: religion, speech, press, assembly, and petition
Well-regulated militia, right to bear arms
Civilians are not required to quarter soliders
No unreasonable search and seizure
Felonies tried only upon grand jury indictment, protections against: Double Jeopardy, Self-Incrimination
Fair, public, and speedy trial by impartial jury
Right to jury trial in civil cases
No excessive bail or excessive fines, no cruel and unusual punishment
Rights shall not be denied due to lack of enumeration in the Bill of Rights
Powers not delegated to the US are reserved for the states
Individuals cannot sue states in Federal Court
Each Electoral College member casts one vote for President and one for VP
Abolished slavery
Citizenship Clause, Privileges or Immunities Clause, Due Process Clause, and Equal Protection Clause
Right to vote shall not be denied or abridged on account of race, color, or previous condition of servitude
Allows Congress to levy an income tax without apportioning it among the states on the basis of population
Popular election of Senators, Governors fill vacancies temporarily until Special Election
Prohibition of manufacture, sale, or transportation of intoxicating liquors
Women's suffrage
Reduced 'lame duck' period for POTUS and VP, incoming Congress holds contingent election for Electoral College deadlock
Repeal of 18th Amendment (Prohibition)
Two term presidential limit, 10 year total including succession
Right to vote for DC residents, Electoral College representation for DC (<= least-populous state)
Abolition of poll tax
Presidential succession and disability, VP becomes President if POTUS dies, resigns, or is removed from office
Voting age changed from 21 to 18
Congressional salary changes will not take effect until the start of the next term for Representatives
